definitions: characterized by strong winds or exposed to much wind
examples: It's too windy to play badminton outside
The windy conditions made sailing dangerous

definitions: equipped with wings for flight or having wing-like structures
examples: The winged insects buzzed around the flowers
Ancient statues depicted winged gods and goddesses

definitions: not having wings; unable to fly due to absence of wings
examples: Wingless ants crawled along the ground
The wingless bird species evolved on isolated islands

definitions: having failed to win any games, matches, or competitions
examples: The winless team struggled with low morale
After a winless season, the coach was replaced

definitions: successful in competition; gaining victory or first place
having attractive qualities that please or charm others
examples: The winning team celebrated their championship
She crossed the finish line with a winning time
His winning smile charmed everyone he met
The puppy had such a winning personality

definitions: attractive or appealing in a fresh, innocent, and engaging way
examples: Her winsome manner delighted the audience
The child's winsome smile melted everyone's hearts

definitions: resembling winter in coldness, bleakness, or harsh weather conditions
examples: The wintry weather brought snow and freezing temperatures
She gave him a wintry look of disapproval

definitions: connected by wires for electricity or electronic communication
feeling nervous, tense, or overly energetic, often from stimulants
examples: The entire building is wired for high-speed internet
Make sure the alarm system is properly wired
After three cups of coffee, he felt completely wired
She was too wired to sleep after the concert

definitions: thin but strong and muscular; resembling wire in toughness
examples: The wiry athlete excelled at long-distance running
His wiry frame belied his incredible strength

definitions: based on wishes rather than facts; expressing unrealistic hope
examples: That's just wishful thinking with no basis in reality
Her wishful dreams of fame seemed increasingly unlikely

definitions: having or showing sad thoughts about something desired but unattainable
examples: She had a wistful expression when looking at old photos
He spoke in wistful tones about his childhood home

definitions: not wanting to communicate with others; shy and reserved
taken back or removed from use, circulation, or consideration
examples: The withdrawn teenager spent most time alone
After the trauma, she became increasingly withdrawn
The withdrawn medication was found to be unsafe
His withdrawn statement changed the case entirely

definitions: dried up and shriveled from age, heat, or loss of moisture
examples: The withered leaves crunched underfoot in autumn
Her withered hands showed her advanced age

definitions: causing something to dry up, shrivel, or lose vitality
expressing scorn or contempt in a way that humiliates
examples: The withering heat destroyed the crop yield
Plants were withering without adequate water
She gave him a withering look of contempt
His withering criticism destroyed her confidence

definitions: showing quick, clever humor and mental sharpness in speech or writing
examples: Her witty remarks kept everyone laughing at dinner
The comedian was known for witty observations

definitions: having exceptional skill or ability as if by magic
examples: He's a wizard programmer who solves complex problems
Her wizard touch with plants made gardens flourish

definitions: moving unsteadily from side to side; not firm or stable
examples: The wobbly table needed a folded napkin underneath
She felt wobbly after getting off the boat

definitions: gained or achieved through competition, effort, or struggle
examples: Their won freedom came at a great cost
The hard won victory was celebrated by all

definitions: feeling curiosity or doubt; wanting to know about something
examples: She gave him a wondering look full of questions
The children watched with wondering eyes

definitions: inspiring a feeling of wonder, amazement, or admiration; marvelous
examples: The wondrous northern lights danced across the sky
Children found the magic show absolutely wondrous

definitions: covered with growing trees; having many woods or forests
examples: They hiked through the wooded hillside trails
The wooded area provided shelter for wildlife

definitions: containing wood fibers or tissue; having wooden parts
having the characteristics, texture, or appearance of wood
examples: Woody plants have stems that persist year-round
The wine had an unpleasant woody taste
The mushroom had a woody texture when cooked
Some herbs develop woody stems as they mature

definitions: made from the soft hair of sheep or similar animals
examples: She wrapped herself in a warm woolen blanket
The woolen sweater was perfect for winter

definitions: made from the soft hair of sheep or similar animals
examples: The woollen scarf kept her neck warm
He preferred woollen socks for hiking

definitions: having a soft, fluffy texture like wool; covered with wool
lacking in clarity or precision; confused and muddled in thinking
examples: The woolly sheep grazed in the meadow
She wore a woolly hat against the cold
His woolly thinking made the proposal unclear
The report contained woolly ideas without specifics

definitions: having a soft, fluffy texture like wool; covered with wool
lacking in clarity or precision; confused and muddled in thinking
examples: The wooly mammoth had thick fur for warmth
The caterpillar had a wooly appearance
Her wooly explanation left everyone confused
Avoid wooly language in legal documents

definitions: not using words; expressed or communicated without speech or writing
examples: They shared a wordless understanding through glances
Her wordless protest spoke volumes

definitions: able to be worked with or used successfully; practical and feasible
examples: They finally found a workable solution to the problem
The clay becomes more workable when moistened

definitions: experienced in and knowledgeable about human society and its ways
concerned with material rather than spiritual matters; secular
examples: His worldly wisdom came from years of travel
She was too worldly to be fooled easily
He gave up worldly possessions to become a monk
They discussed worldly matters rather than philosophy

definitions: damaged, frayed, or threadbare from long use or wear
showing signs of tiredness, stress, or exhaustion
examples: The worn carpet needed to be replaced
His worn shoes had holes in the soles
She had a worn expression after the long shift
His worn face showed years of hard work

definitions: causing anxiety, concern, or unease about actual or potential problems
examples: The worrying news spread quickly through town
There's a worrying trend in unemployment rates

definitions: of poorer quality or lower standard; more serious or severe
examples: The weather got worse as the day progressed
His condition is worse than we initially thought

definitions: having become worse; deteriorated in condition, quality, or severity
examples: The worsened economy affected everyone's finances
Her worsened symptoms required immediate medical attention

definitions: becoming progressively worse; deteriorating in condition or quality
examples: The worsening storm forced evacuations
His worsening behavior concerned his family

definitions: showing or feeling profound reverence, adoration, or religious devotion
examples: The crowd watched with worshipful attention
She gazed at him with worshipful eyes

definitions: regarded with deep respect, adoration, or religious devotion
examples: The worshipped leader could do no wrong
Ancient worshipped idols were discovered in the temple

definitions: of the poorest quality or lowest standard; most serious or severe
examples: This was the worst storm in decades
That's the worst idea I've ever heard

definitions: having no value, use, or importance; completely without worth
examples: The counterfeit bills were completely worthless
He felt worthless after losing his job

definitions: worth the time, effort, or money spent; sufficiently valuable or important
examples: Volunteering at the shelter is very worthwhile
The long journey was worthwhile for the view

definitions: suffering from a physical injury, especially from violence or accident
emotionally hurt or damaged by someone's words or actions
examples: The wounded soldiers received medical attention
A wounded animal can be very dangerous
His wounded pride made him withdraw from friends
She still felt wounded by his harsh criticism

definitions: causing physical or emotional injury, pain, or damage
examples: His wounding remarks left her in tears
The wounding blow required immediate surgery

definitions: formed by interlacing threads, strands, or strips of material
examples: The woven basket held fresh fruit
Stories were woven throughout the family history

definitions: covered, enclosed, or bound with paper, cloth, or other material
examples: The wrapped presents sat under the tree
She stayed wrapped in blankets all day

definitions: severely damaged or destroyed, especially in an accident
extremely tired, exhausted, or intoxicated to the point of dysfunction
examples: The wrecked car was towed from the highway
The storm left wrecked buildings everywhere
I'm completely wrecked after that workout
He was too wrecked to drive home safely

definitions: causing great emotional distress or anguish; extremely difficult emotionally
examples: Saying goodbye was a wrenching experience
The wrenching decision tore the family apart

definitions: in a very unhappy or unfortunate state; feeling deep misery
of very poor quality; extremely bad or inadequate
examples: The wretched refugees needed immediate help
She felt wretched about forgetting his birthday
They lived in wretched conditions without heat
The food was absolutely wretched at that restaurant

definitions: having lines, creases, or folds on the surface, especially from age
examples: His wrinkled shirt needed ironing
Her wrinkled hands showed a lifetime of work

definitions: making twisting, squirming movements, especially from pain or discomfort
examples: The writhing snake slithered through the grass
He was writhing in agony from the injury

definitions: relating to the Protestant churches following Martin Luther's teachings
examples: They attended the Lutheran church every Sunday
Lutheran theology emphasizes salvation by faith alone
